message.content:
cs.SD, cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.NE

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Speech and Dialogue (cs.SD) as it presents a text-to-speech synthesis system that generates audio and tongue motion directly from text. Additionally, the paper mentions the use of a statistical parametric speech synthesis system, which is commonly used in speech and dialogue research.

The paper could also belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Computation and Language (cs.CL) as it involves natural language processing and speech synthesis. 

The use of a three-dimensional model and statistical parametric synthesis suggests that the paper could also belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Signal Processing (cs.SI).

The paper's focus on training a model and evaluating its performance suggests that it could also belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Machine Learning (cs.LG).

Finally, the paper's use of a multimodal articulatory database suggests that it could also belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of Neural and Evolutionary Computing (cs.NE).
